page.title: 06WOKINGHAM - HOUSING
page.content: In 1981 there were 13100 households in the plan area, 82%{ {PRIVATELY OWNED,}12% local authority property and 6% private rented accommodation. The most recent decision for the{ {DISTRICT COUNCIL}is for a mixed development for elderly people and families. This is proposed for the Glebelands site and will amount to about 330 units. Within{WOKINGHAM TOWN CENTRE}a number of sites have been chosen for redevelopment for residential purposes. All new residential development shows a high standard of design which enhances the existing environment. Since 1983 specific policies have applied to{ROSE STREET,}which is residential in character and important in{ARCHITECTURAL AND HISTORIC QUALITY.
